#alsa is probably good, for sound setup stuff.

sort of. You'll probably need to remove the kernel modules for all sound stuff, then blacklist the kernel modules for your various sound cards, then manually load them in the order you want them to appear. when you figure out the order, you'll need to make them load in a script during bootup in that order.
any change in where it's putting things?
ick, need to kill whatever is using it. probably gnome-settings.
have you put snd_emu10k1 in /etc/modules.conf, and rebooted? and it didn't make a difference?
I got CL cards working for 2 other people with the /etc/modules trick. I can't see why it doesn't work for you. :/
probably that you need to manually reset mixer settings, because it stores&loads them by card number, not name
other possibility is that you broke something and it's not loading sound modules before trying to restore sound settings.
